column5: This is a reverse question but I would like to know what are the times to avoid crossing over from Canada to the USA. I will be crossing over at Hwy 81 not that it matters much as most border crossings get busy at the same times. I normaly cross way early in the am but I will be hopefully crossing during the daytime this time around. I would like to know what time in the am does it start to get backed up? How bad is it at lunchtime?Thanks in advance.Keep releasing them allRichard Collinhttp://www.trophymuskiecharters.com
Here is a good site to check on border crossings!!http://www.ccra-adrc.gc.ca/customs/g...es/menu-e.html

Doesn't seem to matter, as how long it takes is primarily based on the State Dept's "Alert" level for that particular day and that particular crossing. Generally mid to late morning is worst. Before 8:00 A.M. and after 5:00 P.M. are best.
